title: Grammar and Vocabulary Quiz
description: Test your grammar and vocabulary skills with this quiz. Answer questions related to correct spelling, word usage, punctuation, synonyms, and more to enhance your language proficiency.

items.question: What is the correct spelling of the word meaning 'a sudden and violent overthrow of a government'?
choices: Coup
Coop
Koop
Kuup

items.question: Identify the correct usage of the word 'ubiquitous' in a sentence.
choices: The sun is ubiquitous in the sky.
Her ubiquitous behavior caused a stir.
The ubiquitous tree provided shade.
He was ubiquitous to attend the meeting.

items.question: Choose the sentence with the correct punctuation:
choices: I cannot go out; I have to finish my homework.
I cannot go out I have to finish my homework
I cannot go out, I have to finish my homework
I cannot go out: I have to finish my homework
items.answer: I cannot go out; I have to finish my homework.

items.question: Which of the following is a hyperbole?
choices: It's a bit chilly today.
I've told you a million times.
She was as busy as a bee.
The river flows gently.
items.answer: I've told you a million times.

items.question: Identify the correct synonym for 'ephemeral'.
choices: Enduring
Transient
Eternal
Perpetual

items.question: What is the correct plural form of 'octopus'?
choices: Octopuses
Octopi
Octopodes
Octopussies

items.question: Select the sentence with the correct subject-verb agreement:
choices: The team are playing well.
Neither of them were present.
Each of the students is required to submit their assignment.
The staff is on lunch break.
items.answer: The staff is on lunch break.

items.question: Choose the correct usage of the word 'ambiguous':
choices: The instructions were clear and ambiguous.
His ambiguous attitude confused everyone.
The ambiguous sky cleared up later.
She received an ambiguous response to her question.
items.answer: She received an ambiguous response to her question.

items.question: Which of the following is a correctly punctuated compound sentence?
choices: She ran quickly, yet she missed the bus.
He didn't finish his dinner, because he was not hungry.
Although it rained, but the event continued.
They reached the destination, their journey was long.
items.answer: She ran quickly, yet she missed the bus.

items.question: Identify the correct use of the word 'supercilious' in a sentence.
choices: His supercilious behavior made him popular.
The supercilious mountain stood tall.
She gave a supercilious smile after winning.
The supercilious of the situation was evident.
items.answer: She gave a supercilious smile after winning.
